instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board came in with corrosion on <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>. Cleaned and replaced both, but still not powering up.

I'm missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> - 0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_REG_R</SIGNAL> is present at 3.3

When attempting smc bypass, the fan spins for twice for about 2 secs each time and then stops. 

Any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
When in SMC bypass, all voltages try to appear?
Check all big coils and <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> too.
Be sure to get <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> voltage.

Test board alone on the desk; no LIO flex connected, nor trackpad.
Check <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - tries to come on. Goes up to 0.7 then drops (same as with the fan coming on and off)
All the coils are doing the same thing as <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> as the pulse up and down, except the lcd backlight which expected since the display is not connected.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - goes up to 1.6 before dropping out as well.
<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> -  3.3 the whole time. never drops out

Same result with LIO flex not plugged in

<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 3.3
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> - 3.3
<SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> - 3.4

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"All the coils are doing the same thing as <SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> as the pulse up and down"
Even L7310/20?

Pin 3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pulses to?

In normal mode, check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes, it also pulses on L7310/20 and Pin3/<CHIP>U1950</CHIP>

<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> - 2.8
<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>  - 0
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - 0.027
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> - 0
